Doña Lucila labora en un negocio familiar, elaboran artículos en hierro forjado como faroles, bancas, rejas, pasamanos, etc. En el negocio se encuentra hace 20 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hierro, suelda y pinturas para el negocio.

Su meta es agrandar su negocio.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The community bank Sol Naciente consists of 6 members who live in different places in the city of Cuenca. Since December 1999 this city is a Cultural Heritage of Humanity site. It is bathed by four rivers, has several tourist attractions, and its cuisine captivates the palates of locals and visitors alike. The people of Cuenca are kind, gentle, and warm-hearted, just like the group members. These women are fighters who work day after day to improve their income and make ends meet with their families, and they maintain the culture and tradition of their parents.  

One of the group members is Lucila. She is 45 years old and lives in Cuenca in the sector of Vergel. Lucila is married and with her husband has had 7 children of ages 27, 24, 21, 20, 18, 15, and 6. Two of her children are married and live on their own. Her second and fourth child work and help her financially, while her fifth daughter studies in high school and also works. Her sixth daughter is in high school and her seventh goes to a small city school. Lucila's husband is an industrial mechanic. They do not have their own house so they rent.

Lucila works in a family business making wrought iron items like lanterns, benches, railings, handrails, etc. She has been in this business for 20 years and works Monday through Saturday with no set schedule. 

Lucila has been a member of the community bank for a year and a half. She will use the money from this loan to purchase iron, welding, and paints for her business. Her goal is to expand her business.

The two small photos in the picture are of two group members who could not be present at the time of the group photo.

loans.use: to purchase iron, welding, and paints.

loans.name: Phana

texts.en:
Phana, age 27, is a farmer. She has been involved in her agricultural business for over five years, and she has extensive experience and success in her career. She lives with her husband and two children in Kam Pot Province, Cambodia. She is involved both in growing rice and raising animals. Approximately, she earns USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who can earn about USD 4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Phana wants to start up an additional career to generate more income to support the family. Phana is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of USD 600 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to run a motor taxi public transportation service. 

In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger so as to provide better living conditions for the family. She also wishes to provide for her children to obtain bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he can offer a motor taxi public transportation service

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza natural y arquitectónica, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, su gente tienen un gran carisma y un corazón cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Julia tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 12, 11 y  1 año de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian en colegio y en escuela. Su esposo es artesano, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Doña Julia trabaja con su esposo en un taller de tapicería que es propio, esta actividad la vienen desempeñando hace 16 años y laboran de lunes a sábados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su crédito lo va a invertir comprando telas, cuerinas, esponjas, pegamento, etc. para su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the El Arenal communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its natural and architectural beauty.  Since 1999 it has been a World Heritage Site.  It is the third most important city in the country's economy.  Its people have great charisma and warm hearts, and they maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.  

Julia is 35 years old and married, and there are 3 children of the marriage aged 12, 11 and 1.  Her first two daughters are attending school.  Her husband is an artesan.  They live in a rented house.

Julia works with her husband in an upholstery shop that they own.  They have been doing this work for 16 years and they work from Monday to Saturday, from 7 in the morning until 6 at night.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years and will invest her loan to buy fabric, imitation leather, upholstery foam, glue, etc. for her business.

Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy fabric, imitation leather, upholstery foam, glue, etc.

loans.name: Fénix De Asís Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Fénix de Asís” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran confección de ropa, peluquería, repostería, artesanía, venta de ropa y perfumes por catálogo. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Sara presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila sentada, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Viste con una blusa de color blanco y diseños, su cabello lo usa recogido y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, ya que atiende un bazar en el cual vende productos de paquetería y librería, además ha incorporado también la venta de ropa usada. Se dedica a éste negocio desde hace tres años, junto a sus dos hijos, quienes además son sus socios.  Trabaja de lunes a domingo en un horario de 10ºº de la mañana hasta las 10ºº de la noche. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras en la ciudad de Santiago y comenta que de acuerdo a cada temporada.
Con el crédito comprará útiles escolares y también un poco de ropa abrigadora para la temporada de invierno.
Sus metas son ampliar la infraestructura de su local comercial e incorporar la venta de bebidas y helados, ya que su local está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad y existe gran concurrencia de personas.
Sara vive junto a sus dos hijos, el mayor de ellos trabaja de manera dependiente como topógrafo y su hijo menor comenzará a estudiar la carrera de Técnico en energía renovable. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal. Ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Fénix de Asís” and is composed of 15 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of lines of work among which there is clothes making, barber shop, pastry shop, crafts, clothing and perfume sales via catalogue.  All of them are from the city of Rancagua.

Sara is communal bank president.  In the photo she’s seated in the first row occupying the first spot from right to left.  She’s wearing a white printed blouse and her hair is gathered and is dark brown.

She’s a merchant tending to a general store selling stationery and packing items; she’s also added used clothes sales.  She’s been in this business for three years together with her two children who are also her partners.  She works Monday to Sunday from 10am until 10pm.  She buys her merchandise from distributors in the city of Santiago and she comments that she does so according to each season.

She will use the loan to buy school supplies and also some warm winter clothes.  Her goals are to expand her store’s infrastructure and to start selling beverages and ice cream since her store is located in the center of the city and many people pass by.

Sara lives with her two children.  The oldest works independently as a topographer and her younger son will start to study a career as a renewable energy technician.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She comments that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development because she’s learned how to organize and better distribute her income and investments.

Rancagua belongs to the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins Region.  It’s a modern city that regulates Chile’s main fruit and wine industry’s processes and export.  It is also a mining city because the world’s largest underground mine, “El Teniente,” with 4500 kilometers of tunnels is found in its mountain range.

loans.use: to buy shool supplies and some warm winter clothes.

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es:
Crispin es un hombre de 40 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia, en el pueblo joven San Martín, en la zona urbano marginal de Lambayeque. Su domicilio cuenta con servicio de luz y agua, es una comunidad pequeña  con un aproximado de 100 familias.
La actividad que realiza Crispín es la comercialización de repuestos para mototaxis (vehículo motorizado de 3 ruedas que sirve para transladar personas y carga) y bicicletas, adicionalmente también vende lubricantes, y resulta un negocio muy rentable debido a la gran cantidad de estos vehículos que circulan por las zonas aledañas a su residencia. Además, Crispín cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de la confección de carpas para mototaxis.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1500 nuevos soles, el cual estará destinado a la compra de repuestos para mototaxis y bicicletas y para la compra de lubricantes.
texts.en:
Crispin is a 40 year old man who is married and has three children. He lives in his own house, in the young town of San Martín, on the outskirts of the city of Lambayeque. His home has electric and water service, and he lives in a small community with approximately 100 families.
Crispin sells spare parts for mototaxis and bicycles (mototaxis are 3-wheeled motorized vehicles used to transport people and cargo). He also sells lubricants. His business is very profitable due to the large quantity of these vehicles that are used in the areas near his home. Additionally, Crispin has extra income since he makes soft-shell roofs for mototaxis.
The amount of the loan requested is 1500 PEN [$575], which will be used to purchase spare parts for mototaxis and bicycles, as well as to purchase lubricants.

loans.use: to acquire more spare parts.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Dora Angelica,es miembro del grupo "Mujeres Triunfadoras", una socia muy trabajadora y responsable. El grupo está formado por 8 integrantes residentes del distrito de Comas, en la zona de Belaunde.
Desde hace muchos años, al lado de su esposo atienden su negocio de zapatos, gracias a su trabajo ellos han logrado solventar sus gastos y hacer crecer su negocio. Les gustaría que mas adelante pudieran abrir otros locales y expandir su negocio.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de zapatillas, sandalias y calzado de verano.
texts.en: Dora Angelica is a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" group, and is a hard-working and responsible partner.  Her group has 8 members living in the Comas district, in the Belaunde zone.  For many years she has worked alongside her husband at their shoe business.  Thanks to their work they have succeeded in paying their expenses and growing their business.  They would like to be able to open more locations later on, and expand their business.  The loan received will be invested in buying slippers, sandals and other summer shoes.

loans.use: to buy slippers to increase their stock.

loans.name: Sama Group

texts.en:
This group, called SAMA, consists of four members who are all female: Noriah, Khlod, Ebtsam and Rwida, who is the group leader. They are from Taiz, Yemen, and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same neighborhood for a long time. All their businesses are home-based; however, they have many clients, mostly women. They have requested a loan of 320,000Yemeni rials (YER).

Rwida is a 36-year-old married woman who has four children attending school. She is the woman sitting down in the centre. Rwida is a seamstress who sews ladies clothes for neighborhood clients. She started on her own six years ago and works ten hours daily. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. It is her main source of income. She has kept the business going with help of three loans that have made it possible for her to improve her quality of life.

Currently Rwida is asking for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy a new sewing machine. This will help her complete client orders on-time and increase her profits. With her current machine, she is unable to finish orders on time. Rwida would like to employ her friends who are currently unemployed in order to open a sewing factory.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Mirna Guadalupe

texts.es: Mirna Guadalupe de cuarenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una venta de antojitos en el lugar de su residencia pastelitos, enchiladas, tamales, empanadas, entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles, además el servicio es incomparable; Mirna Guadalupe es una mujer con muchos objetivos por delante dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzarlos, piensa que lo más importante en la vida no es superar a los demás, sino superarnos a nosotros mismos, es con esa actitud que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima, maíz, carnes, verduras, etc. Mirna Guadalupe tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna Guadalupe is 40, and lives with her life partner and their children. She sells snack foods from her home such as small cakes, enchiladas, tamales, empanadas, and other things, She is very well-known in the area and has gotten a lot of customers; as everything she sells is top-quality, and priced affordably. Besides, the service is incomparable. 

Mirna Guadalupe is a woman with many goals for the future, and ready to work hard to reach them. She believes that the most important thing in life isn't overcoming others, but overcoming ourselves; it is with that attitude that she decided to apply to Integral for a loan, that will allow her to buy ingredients such as corn, meats, and vegetables, etc. Mirna Guadalupe is confident that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn, meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from the village of Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old. Erlinda is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Erlinda has been involved in her business for 13 years and earns 5000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Socorro Isabel

texts.es:
Socorro es madre de una hija de 18 años de edad, al que quiere y ama muchísimo, Socorro vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, por la generosidad de sus pobladores, así como también por su agricultura principalmente por el cultivo de arroz, asimismo por su riquísimo Chupe de camarones el cual es el plato típico de la ciudad. Socorro en sus tiempos libres disfruta de mirar películas así como también le gusta comer su plato favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Pescado Frito”. 

Socorro trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa los días domingos en la feria que se realiza en su barrio, así como también venta de cera para pisos; le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas diarias, pero también trabaja como cocinera en una casa; ella es muy trabajadora y por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque se esfuerza mucho y trabaja con gusto.

Socorro está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para sus negocios, tanto como ropa y cera; lo que le permitirá variedad de productos para ofrecer y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá trabajando para poder salir adelante cada día y poder cumplir su más grande sueño: “Darle a su hija una profesión”
texts.en:
Socorro is the mother of an eighteen year old daughter who she loves very much. Socorro lives in the city of Camana, a city known for its warm climate and the generosity of its people, as well as for its agriculture, principally its rice crops. It is also known for its delicious shrimp stew, a traditional meal in the city. In her free time, Socorro enjoys watching movies as well as eating her favorite meal, which is the delicious “Fried Fish.”

Socorro sells clothing on Sundays in the open market in her neighborhood. She also sells floor wax. She works for around eight hours a day, but she also works as a cook in a house. She is very hardworking. She believes her business is doing well because she puts a lot of effort into it and enjoys her work.

Socorro is very grateful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have provided her she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her businesses, both clothing and wax. She will be able to offer a variety of products for sale and increase her profits. This way she will keep working and be able to get ahead each day and be able to achieve her greatest dream: “Give her daughter a profession.”

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing and floor wax).

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen, age 58, lives in Dasmariñas, Cavite, with her husband Edgar, who is her business partner, and their children. They manage their household together while operating the business. 

She is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses through her variety store business. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She earns additional income by preparing and selling cooked viands. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.
     
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Belen hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of providing her children with a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, a 59-year-old resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines who is married to Wyler, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and she also sells cooked viands for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.

Nenita hopes her business grows in the coming year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Angelina de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende artículos de primera necesidad arroz, pan, huevos, leche, jabones entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de excelente calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable se siente el calor de hogar al visitar el negocio; Angelina es una mujer emprendedora muy activa y trabajadora, quien a pesar de su avanzada edad siempre tiene algo que dar para seguir superándose, piensa que la parte física nunca podrá detener el impacto de la fortaleza espiritual, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, especies, producto instantáneo, jabones, etc. Angelina tiene fe que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Angelina is 64, and lives with her family in their own house.  She has a store in her home where she sells basic household necessities such as rice, bread, eggs, milk, soaps and other items. 

Lately she has gotten a lot of customers. as everything she sells is of excellent quality and she sells it at really affordable prices. Besides, the service is unequalled; you feel the warmth of home when visiting the business. 

Angelina is an enterprising woman who is very energetic and hard-working. In spite of the fact she is older, she always has something to give to keep improving herself. She believes that spiritual strength will always overcome the physical part. This is how she decided to apply to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, candy, bread, spices, instant products, soaps, etc. Angelina has faith that in this way, she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, candy, bread, spices, instant products, and soaps.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El señor Ronald, es una persona de 27 años de edad de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato  y actualmente está estudiando una carrera superior, vive en casa de su madre,  no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo; la actividad económica principal a la que se dedica él y su madre es la producción agrícola; producen papa, arveja, maíz y cebada  en sus propias parcelas, las mismas se hallan situadas en la comunidad de  Tíraque lugar donde también se encuentra su domicilio distante aproximadamente a unos 70 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Asimismo cabe mencionar que su madre es de la tercera edad por lo tanto necesita de su cuidado y de la ayuda de Ronald. Finalmente el cliente y su madre manifiestan tener ganas de superarse y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la construcción de una vivienda y de tal forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
 Entre sus sueños y metas del cliente esta terminar su carrera lo más pronto posible para empezar a trabajar y de esa manera mantener a su madre y que ella deje de trabajar.
texts.en:
Ronald, 27, is married and has a vocational high school degree.  He is now in advanced studies, working toward a technical degree.  He lives in his mother's house, and has no dependents in his care.  He and his mother are farmers who produce potatoes, peas, corn and barley on their own land.  They have parcels of land in the community of Tiraque, which is also where they live.  Tiraque is about 70 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  Also, it is worth mentioning that his mother is elderly, and so needs Ronald's help and care.  Ronald and his mother state that they have a desire to improve their life, and so for this reason they are requesting investment capital to be used to build a house.  In this way, they will be able to improve their living conditions.  

One of Ronald's dreams and goals is finishing his degree as quickly as possible, so that he can start to work and in this way support his mother so that she can stop working.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
El señor Macario, es una persona de 47 años de edad de estado civil soltero pero vive en concubinato con su pareja, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia, tiene 4 hijos dependientes, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, produce papa, cebada, haba y arveja (guisantes), asimismo como actividad secundaria brinda los servicios de albañil en la comunidad de Rodeo Alto  Tíraque que esta distante aproximadamente a unos 75 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Cabe mencionar también que la esposa se dedica a la comercialización de hortalizas en las ferias semanales de las poblaciones aledañas.
 En la actividad de la agricultura intervienen toda la familia la esposa y los hijos para poder incrementar su producción  ya que en la actualidad disponen de mayor superficie de terreno  cultivable, por tanto necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de semilla y otros insumos principales para la producción,  de esta forma incrementar su producción de los distintos productos que cultivan de tal forma poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos mejorando de esta manera sus condiciones de vida. Para tal efecto don Macario y su familia se ven en la necesidad de solicitar el crédito para la compra de abono de gallinaza que es fertilizante orgánico esencial para la producción en especial de papa.
texts.en:
Señor Macario is a 47-year-old person of single marital status who lives with his partner.  He graduated from grade school and lives in his own house.  They have 4 dependent children.  The main activity to which he is dedicated is agriculture.  He produces potatoes, barley, beans and vetch (peas).  In addition, as a secondary activity he offers his services as a bricklayer in the community of Rodeo Alto Tíraque that this approximately 75 Km. distant from the city of Cochabamba.  He sees fit to mention that his wife is dedicated to selling vegetables in the weekly fairs of the adjoining population centers.  
The whole family participates in the agricultural activities.  His wife and children help to be able to increase their production since they currently have a greater expanse of arable land.  Therefore they need to buy a greater quantity of seed and other main supplies for production.  In this way they hope to increase their production of the different products that they cultivate in such a way as to be able to obtain a greater economic income and in this manner improve their living conditions.  For such effect, Señor Macario and his family have seen need to request the loan to purchase organic fertilizer for the production especially of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 49, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Geraldo, her business partner. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milagros maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Milagros hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana Editha

texts.en:
This is Ana, 42, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ana maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ana hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.es:
María Alejandrina es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada y vive en casa propia ubicada en el caserío Tabacal, en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume.  La mayoría de los pobladores de esa zona son comerciantes independientes dedicados a la venta de ganado pequeño.
La actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de animales y al jornal. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la agricultura. El negocio de venta de animales cuenta ya con clientela fija.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es igual a 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se destinarán a la compra de animales y para el alimento de los mismos. María se ha propuesto a ampliar su inventario en lo referente a la venta de animales puesto que es un negocio muy rentable en la zona.
texts.en: María Alejandrina is a 39-year-old woman, married lives in a house located in the Tabacal neighborhood, in a rural area of the Tucume district.  Most of the inhabitants of this area are independent merchants that sell livestock.  Her activity is to sell livestock and labor paid by the day.  In addition she works in agriculture.  The business of livestock sales already has steady clients.  The loan requested is 2,000 new soles, which will be used to buy livestock and feed.  Maria has proposed herself to expand the inventory related to livestock because it's a business very profitable in the area.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed to expand her business.

loans.name: Munir

texts.en:
Munir is 40 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a married man with five children who are all currently in school. He is a person who has experienced a lot of difficulties in life. However, his desire to work and make progress has allowed him to overcome these difficulties and continue making progress together with his family. For the past years, Munir has been working hard to manage his small business selling ladies clothes. 

Thanks to his good customer service, Munir has gained a very good customer base. This allows him to make very good sales. With the aim of stocking his business, he would like to take out a loan of 200,000 Yemeni rials from AMB. This loan will allow him to buy more ladies clothes for resale such as skirts, dresses, blouses, robes and shirts, etc. This will enable him to offer his customers a larger variety of products. Munir hopes to be able to continue making the income he needs for his household and to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more ladies clothes for resale such as skirts, dresses, blouses, robes and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Borrower Gantuya is a 34-year-old married lady who lives with her husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. They live in the outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

Since 2003, she has been operating her current business at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia with special help from her spouse.  They usually sell leather wallets, gloves, and other items, which they purchase once or twice a month in Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China.

Gantuya has about 3.8 million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. In Mongolia it is now the beginning of spring season, so Gantuya needs more goods to sell.  So she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods to sell at her small stall.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda where she is a married mother of five children, all in school. For the past two years Hasifa has been selling second-hand shoes at the market seven days a week, and generates additional income through tailoring. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation.

Hasifa is now requesting a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand shoes. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Tern

texts.en:
Tern, 61, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been sewing palm leaf thatches for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her son is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day.

Due to difficulties in the family’s transportation, Tern is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This will enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, Tern would like to establish a grocery store at home to generate more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Espíritu Santo, integrada por 20 emprendedoras señoras y señoritas quienes a diario se esfuerzan por salir adelante y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de sus respectivas familias, actualmente se encuentran en el décimo ciclo, y tienen un gran deseo de lucha y superación.
Catalina vende frutas y nos comenta que este es un buen trabajo, debido a que tiene buena venta y una clientela bien formada. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y su meta es poder tener un local amplio don de poder offrecer sus frutas a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito, ya que desea tener mayor frutas en stock y quiere comprar manzanas, bananas, peras, limones y demás tipos. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad de progreso que ha recibido.
texts.en:
This group is named Espíritu Santo.  It is composed of 20 women entrepreneurs who strive daily to get ahead and improve the quality of life of their respective families.  At this time they are in their 10th loan cycle and have a great desire to achieve and win.  
Catalina sells fruits and she tells us it is good work, due to the fact that she has good sales and a well formed clientele.  She is known as an enterprising and very hard-working person, and her goal is to be able to have a larger store to be able to offer more fruit to her clients.  
She requests a loan, since she wants to have a greater supply of fruit in stock.  She wants to buy apples, bananas, pears, lemons and other types.  She is very thankful for this opportunity and the progress that it has helped her achieve.  .

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline, a 35-year old married mother of four children ranging in age from 10 years to 23 years, describes herself as honest. For the past three years she has been operating a retail business selling coconut. Her business is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are men. Her biggest challenge is inadequate funds for improving the enterprise.

Evaline is now requesting a Kes 20,000 loan to buy more coconuts. Her dream and business goal is to be a major coconut supplier within five years.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Kovans

texts.en: Kovans lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of her father. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a delivery van to help with transportation, and to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Monsieur Amadou  est éleveur depuis plus de 40 ans. Il est âgé de 45 ans est marié et père de 8 enfants. Il est à son second crédit à l’IMCEC. Ce dernier qu’il va faire lui servira à acheter de l’aliment pour  son  bétail. Avec les revenus de son activité, Adama gère les besoins quotidiens de son foyer. Il  a aussi la charge de ses bêtes. IL réussi à épargner  et travaille à améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. Grace aux bénéfices, il s’acquitte convenablement des remboursements du crédit. Pour faciliter  l’accès à l’eau à ses betes, il veut  chercher un puits dans le champ c’est le projet qu’il nourri présentement.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama is a 45-year-old married father of eight children who has been raising cattle for over 40 years. He is seeking a second loan from UIMCEC, and he plans to use the funds to purchase cattle feed. He uses the income earned from his activity to handle the daily household expenses, and he also provides for the animals in his care. 

He manages to save some money, and he strives to improve his family’s situation with respect to food. His profits allow him to make the loan repayments. 

For the time being, his goal is to find a well in the field in order for his cattle to have easy access to water.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and fatten his cows prior to selling them.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a 25-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 3 and 7 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, Blue Band (a brand of margarine), stationery, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. 

His business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase maize and wheat flour. 

Jumaa's dream and business goal is to run a big supermarket within five years.

loans.use: to buy more maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than ten years and is successful in her career. She grows crops and raises cattle. Additionally, she sells vegetables and fruits, and makes religious articles to sell in order to generate more income to support her family. Her husband is a policeman who earns about 5 USD per day. One of her children is a high school teacher who earns approximately 4 USD per day. 

In order to improve her business, Chantha is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase vegetables and fruits in larger quantities to sell. This loan would enable her to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase a store in the market for selling vegetables and fruits, and help her children get their bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger in order to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, a married man with children living in Fort Portal Uganda, has a livestock farm which he bought from personal savings. His biggest challenge is seasonal weather. His dreams include educating his children, improving on his livestock and hiring employees to help expand his business. Robert needs this loan to buy more livestock and sprays.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and sprays.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 62 years old and lives in Tamban, Pta. Miray, Baliangao. She is married and has two children. To earn a living, Anita sells homemade bread. She earns about 3,400 PHP each month doing this work. Anita has a requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make bread. Anita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients needed to make bread

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and 2 are in school. She has additional family members (her father).

Hadjah sells charcoal at the market. She also generates additional income by selling roasted maize. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Hadjah's major business challenges are seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to the university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children and all her children are in school. She also has additional family members (father).

Annet sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She works 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality, transportation and lack of customers. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into wholesale. 

Annet lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband works at RIA. They have 3 children between the ages of 9 to 14. All of them are attending school and live at home. For the past 10 years, Aba has been selling used clothes at the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to be a big business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Aissata Fatouma

texts.fr:
Madame Aissata Fatouma est une dame de 50 ans qui a 4 enfants dont l’ainé a 20 ans et le plus jeune 7 ans. Elle fait de la vente de légumes, qu’elle a  démarré  en 2006. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des légumes et les revendre. Ce crédit va impacter  la situation du client car grâce aux bénéfices acquis il va pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille, épargner de l’argent et rembourser normalement son crédit.
Comme projets futurs, il veut acheter de jeunes vaches petit à petit pour faire de l’embouche.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissata Fatouma is a 50-year-old lady with four children aged 7 to 20. She has been selling vegetables since 2006. She is seeking a loan to buy vegetables for resale. 

This loan will be of great assistance as it will allow her to earn profits that will help to improve her family’s food situation, to save money, and to repay her loan without difficulty.

One of her future goals is to buy young cows to fatten.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Josten,

texts.en:
Josten is a 34-year-old businessman who lives in Juba Yei. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 2. Two of them go to school. 

Josten runs a special clothing store business, and he has been in the business for 4 years. He has no employees. Josten heard about Finance South Sudan from a loan officer’s promotion done in the market, as well as through a radio advertisement. He is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more items like special clothing for women, men and many others. In addition to this business, Josten has motorbike for bodaboda as another source of income. 

In 5 years' time, Josten would like to expand the business to a good boutique shop. His major challenges include the low income rate, home expenses and daily differences from buying from whole sellers.

Josten says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance South Sudan for supporting him with additional capital for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like special clothing for women, men and many others

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past five years, he has owned and operated a retail shop. He started this shop by using the savings from a produce business that he had. His main challenge is price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is to build a permanent home and to diversify his business to a wholesale shop. Clovice needs this loan to buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a married man with children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop where he has been working for a very long time. He faces a hardship of price fluctuation and inflation. His dream is to educate his children and to diversify his business. Lawrence needs this loan to buy general merchandise like soda and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like soda and sugar

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 43 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 12 and 20. All of her children are currently in school and live at home. For the past four years she has been selling rubber cups, plates, spoons, and tubs in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber cups, plates, spoons, and tubs for her business. Having more customers is what she likes about her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber cups, plates, spoons, and tubs

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is a 50-year-old businessman who lives in Juba Yei. He is married with 8 children between the ages of 4 and 19. All of them go to school. 

Levi runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for 6 years. He has 1 employee. Levi heard about Finance South Sudan from the loan officer’s promotion done in the market, as well as through the radio advertisement. He is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more items like sugar, biscuits, water, and rice. In addition to this business, Levi has houses for rent as another source of income. 

In 5 years' time, Levi would like for a better set-up of the business in the same market. His major challenges include low income and daily differences from buying from the whole sellers.

Levi says that he is very happy with Finance South Sudan for supporting him with additional capital for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, biscuits, water, and rice.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a produce store that he started five years ago. He started with capital worth 800,000 shillings and now it's worth 2,000,000 shillings. John's challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, high transportation costs, and the seasonal changes making it hard to ascertain the season of planting and harvesting. His dreams include educating his children, buying a motorcycle, expanding his business into a renown produce store, and completing his house. 

John needs this loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation since he has to move to villages to buy the produce himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 46, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Alfredo, a construction worker. They have two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Melinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also sells cooked foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.     

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 8000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Melinda hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of giving all her children a high quality education with all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Johnmary

texts.en: Johnmary wants a loan to buy more soft drinks, salt, sugar and other general merchandise for reselling. He is a 62-year-old married man with eleven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a semi-permanent house. He runs a retail shop. He dreams of building a permanent residential house, educating his children and starting up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, salt, sugar and other general merchandise for reselling

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Delia quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Actualmente se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto dentro de un ambiente de ayuda y repeto.
La sra. Delia tiene una despensa, esta casada con el señor Antonio, tienen  6 hijos, 5 mayores de edad e independientes, y una menor de edad que vive con ellos. Delia tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.                    
Ella solicita el credito  para la compra de panificados, bebidas, golosinas, yerba, etc. Con lo cual podrá surtir su despensa y tener siempre productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The person who initiated this communal bank was Delia, who invited and organized her friends to join the program Communal Bank of Women Entrepreneurs. Now they are happily working together in an atmosphere of support and respect.

Delia has a store, is married to Antonio, and has 6 children. Five of the children are of legal age and independent, and one is a minor who lives with them. Delia's goal is to grow her business and offer her family a better lifestyle. 

She is requesting this loan to buy baked goods, beverages, sweets, maté, etc., with which she will be able to stock her store and always have products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Patrick Olimi

texts.en: Patrick is a 45-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in taxi transport, where he has worked for over five years. He started this business through personal savings. He faces hardships of high taxes and high fuel costs. His dreams are to build a permanent home and buy land to grow crops. Patrick needs this loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Vereryano

texts.en: Vereryano, aged 50, is a married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer and deals in coffee and maize produce. He dreams of educating his four children, building a permanent house and buying a car or motorcycle to ease transportation problems. He wants a loan to buy maize and coffee for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee for selling

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La socia Ana continua con la agricultura y a la crianza de vacas y animales menores como chanchos, cuyes, aves de corral,  la socia sigue llevando sus animalitos y su produccion a vender en los diferentes mercados en la ciudad de Cusco. Ahora la socia desea continua con sus actividades y seguir creciendo economicamnete y mejorar sus ventas, a ella le ha sido muy dificil este año con la agricultura puesto que llovio mucho y casi malogra sus productos de cultivo. La socia desea el crédito para la compra cosechar sus tierras y llevar su produccion en carro hasta la ciudad, ella vive en una com¡unidad no muy accesible por ello le costara el transporte. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en el alquiler de transporte para llevar sus productos y venderlos.
texts.en: The member, Ana, continues farming and raising cows and small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and poultry and taking her little animals and crops to sell in different markets in Cusco.  Now she wants to continue her businesses, to keep growing economically and to improve her sales.  This has been a difficult year for agriculture since it rained a lot and almost ruined her crops.  Ana wishes to use the loan to take her crops to sell by car to the city.  She lives in a remote village and transportation is expensive.  She will use the money to rent the transport to take her products for sale.

loans.use: to rent transportation to take her products for sale

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Biviana; continua con su negocio y con la agricultura  y con la crianza de animales menores La socia a incrementado sus ventas y le a ido muy bien ahora ella desea comprar pollos y gallinas, tambien cuyes para crecer aun mas y hacerlos reproducir y vender.
texts.en:
Biviana continues with her business, with farming, and with raising small animals.  She has increased her sales, and it has gone very well for her.

She now wishes to buy chickens, hens, and guinea pigs.  She wants them to grow more, have them reproduce, and sell them.

loans.use: to buy poultry to sell.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Hilaria; continua con la agricultura  y también tiene compra y venta de animales menores, la socia esta feliz porque esta creciendo y ya hace de esta actividad un negocio rentable;  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros.
texts.en:
Hilaria continues working in agriculture.  She also buys and sells small animals.  She is happy because her business is growing, and she has made it a profitable business.

She is requesting the loan to buy small animals like guinea pigs and hens, among others.

loans.use: to buy animals like guinea pigs, hens, pigs, and sheep.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 28-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a tea plantation, which he started seven years ago. He started as a casual labourer, then he devoted knowledge and capital to start his own plantation. His challenges are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. His dreams are to educate his children, build a permanent home, buy a car, diversify the business and hire employees to help him expand his business. Robert intends to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings for planting

loans.name: Bonefasi

texts.en: Bonefasi is a 45-year-old married man with nine children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He practices mixed farming, which he started 12 years ago. He got his capital to start this business by quarrying pazzoland. He faces challenges of price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. His dreams are to educate his children, build a permanent home, diversify his business and move the business to a more permanent location. Bonefasi needs this loan to buy a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 35-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has practiced crop farming for over four years. He started as a supervisor in someone's tea plantation and after a while he planted his own. He faces challenges of price fluctuation, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. His dreams are to educate his children, build a permanent home, buy a car and hire employees to help in expanding his business. Charles needs this loan to buy and plant 10,000 tea seedlings.

loans.use: to buy and plant tea seedlings

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a chef for over two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately $5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Leap wants to run an additional business to generate more income to support the family. Therefore, Leap is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase groceries to sell from home. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home.

loans.name: Fiorella Lizbeth

texts.es:
Fiorella Lizbeth es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada y con 2 hijos. Tiene domicilio en el sector de La Matanza, en la zona urbana. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Se dedica a la comercialización de abarrotes en la bodega que tiene en su casa, para todo el sector de La Matanza y zonas aledañas. Todas las personas que comercializan abarrotes lo hacen en sus casas debido a que no existe un mercado general.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 2010 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, y muebles para la exhibición de la mercadería, como un andamio y un mostrador, ya que así incitará a los clientes a ir a su bodega ya que con esos muebles y la ambientación correspondiente, se hace más vistosa la visita.
texts.en:
Fiorella Lizbeth is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Her home is in the urban area of La Matanza. She has good personal and professional references.

She sells groceries in the bodega in her house to people throughout La Matanza and the outlying areas. All the people who sell groceries do so from their homes because there is no general market.
 
The amount of the loan she is requesting is 2010 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy groceries, such as rice, and fixtures to showcase her merchandise, such as a shelf and a counter. This will encourage customers to come to her bodega, as the merchandise fixtures and the atmosphere will make their visits brighter.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bananas

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es:
El comité Cañaveral, se formo hace mas de 1 año,  está integrado por 12 señoras.  El comité fue formado con la idea de adquirir pequeño capital para  invertir en sus negocios. Cuentan que sus días de trabajo empiezan desde muy tempranas horas en donde con las ganancias obtenidas compran nuevamente sus productos.
Asunción es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual provee a la mayoría de sus vecinos. Cuenta que tiene mucha venta, y que gracias a la variedad y buenos productos que tiene cada vez se suman mas clientes. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma tener un poco más de ingresos.
Asunción acude a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva, para solicitar un préstamo, el cual desea invertir en la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, artículos de limpieza y demás artículos con los cuales quiere llenar su despensa.
texts.en:
The Cañaveral communal bank was formed more than a year ago.  It is comprised of 12 women.  The bank was formed with the idea of obtaining a small amount of capital to invest in their businesses.  They say that their work days start very early and they buy new inventory with the profits they make.

Asunción is the president of the group.  She tells us that she has a well-stocked grocery store, which supplies most of her neighbors.  She has a lot of sales, and thanks to her variety and good products, she adds more customers all the time.  Her goal is to keep growing so she can have a little more income.

Asunción has turned to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to request a loan, which she would like to invest in food, drinks, dairy products, cleaning products, and other items with which she will stock her store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a grocery store.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos. Vive en una casa familiar en el sector Sapame Bajo, en el distrito de Túcume. La mayoría de los habitantes de esa zona son comerciantes independientes.
La actividad que realiza Kelly es la venta de animales y el servicio de costura, y cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en el referido rubro. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la agricultura. El negocio de venta de animales ya cuenta con una clientela fija. 
El monto del crédito solicitado asciende a 2000 nuevos soles, que estarán destinados a la compra de más animales para su venta y también para la restauración y remodelación del corral donde se crían. Aparte, también tiene pensado comprar alimento para los animales que criará.
texts.en:
Kelly is a 31 year old woman who is single and does not have children.  She lives in a family house in the Sapame Bajo sector in the Túcume district.  Most of the inhabitants in this zone are independent merchants.

Kelly sells animals, and she provides sewing services.  She has three years of experience in that area.  She is also a farmer.  Her business of selling animals already has a fixed clientele.

The requested loan for 2,000 soles is to buy more animals to sell.  It is also for the restoration and remodeling of the corral where she raises the animals.  She is also planning to buy feed for the animals that she will raise.

loans.use: to buy animals in order to have more livestock.

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda is a 51-year-old married woman with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a retail shop, which she started 20 years ago. She started this business by saving and working in a hotel. Her challenges are price fluctuations and seasonal weather. Her dreams are to purchase more merchandise for her retail shop and to diversify the business. Edreda needs this loan to purchase merchandise like tealeaves and washing detergents for  selling.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like tea leaves and washing detergents for selling

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Basilia; continua trabajando con la agricultura  y tambien  criando animales menores; la socia esta saliendo adelante razon por la cual desea seguir invirtiendo su prestamo en la compra d enaimales como una vaca y en la cosecha de suys productos agricolas.
texts.en: This member is called Basilia. She still works in agriculture and she also breeds small animals. She is doing well, so wants to continue to invest her loan in buying animals (such as a cow) and in harvesting her crops.

loans.use: invest in her business by buying a cow and harvesting her crops.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Presented to you in the photo is Alpha, a grocery shop owner in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. Alpha has been a businessman for many years now. A native of Lungi town in Northern Sierra Leone, Alpha is aged thirty-two. He is married to a trader and the couple have two children together. Alpha has requested this loan in order to invest in his business. He will use this loan to buy items like drinks, butter, margarine, mayonnaise, toothpastes, toothbrushes, and soaps at wholesale to add to his bushiness.

loans.use: to buy items at wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a thirty-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop, which he started two years ago. He started this business using personal savings. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His dreams are to educate his children, diversify his business, and move the business to a more permanent location. Anthony needs this loan to buy soda, beer, and cartons of water.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, and cartons of water

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport, where he has worked for over eight years. He started his business through first farming. His major challenge is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His dreams are to educate his children and move the business to a more permanent location. Innocent needs this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Avelina; continua con la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, chanchos los cuales los vende, a la socia le ha ido muy bien y le hace sentir feliz el estar en actividad; la socia en esta ocasion desea continuar con este pequeño negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores como comprar gallinas y chanchos.
texts.en: The member is Avelina; she continues to raise small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, which she sells. The member has done well and is happy doing this work. At this time, she wants to continue this small business. The member is requesting the loan to buy small animals like chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El socio es el Sr. Rosendo; continua como maestro constructor y sigue trabajando en todas las obras que se le presente; el socio no pudo comprar la maquina mezcladora pero lo hara ahora ya que pago la primera parte y la otra utilizo para sembrar unos terrenos familiares y le ha ido bien, ahora el socio desea poder invertir en la ultima cuota para pagar su maquina mezcladora y de este modo hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en: The member requesting the loan is called Rosendo. He is still a master builder and he still works on all building projects that come up. He was not able to buy a cement mixer for some time, but he will be able to purchase it now. He has already paid the first instalment. He used the rest of his money to sow land belonging to his family. Everything has gone well so far. Now he would like to be able to pay the final instalment for the cement mixer and in this way fulfil his dream.

loans.use: invest in a cement mixer.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: This is sixty-year-old Albert. Born in Bo City, in Southern Sierra Leone, Albert is a husband and father of five grown-up children. He is married to a trader. Albert has been a building contractor for many years now. He wants a loan of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy building materials like cement, sand, and iron-corrugated zincs at wholesale. He will then retail it himself whenever he has a building contract.

loans.use: to buy building materials at wholesale

loans.name: Humu

texts.en: Humu (in the photo) is 32 years old. She was born in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone, and has one child. Her husband is a miner and her child is attending primary school. For 20 years, Humu has been selling dishes, cups, spoons, knives, pots, flasks, etc. retail. She is seeking a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones in order to further expand her business. With this loan, she will buy dishes, cups, spoons, knives, pots, flasks, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dishes, cups, spoons, knives, pots, flasks, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a 46-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be honest and determined in her work. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be restrictions by government authorities to cut trees, leading to shortage of firewood for selling. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more firewood for selling. She hopes and dreams to venture in to a hotel business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for selling

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Philip is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged eight and ten years. He owns a motorbike transport business, a business he started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 2,500. 

He has requested for a loan worth KES 5,000 to repair and maintain his motorbike. The anticipated profit will help him expand the business.

He dreams of being successful in his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorbike

loans.name: Arzu

texts.ru: Arzu 44 let, ona zamujem, u nee 2 detey. Arzu nachala svoy biznes 13 let nazad, sfera ee biznesa eto prodaja jenskoy odejdi. Muj Arzu  rabotaet masterom i iz sovmestnogo daxoda oni planiruyut postroit dom dla sina.  Segodna dengi nujni Arzu dla togo chtobi kupit novie veshi I postavit na prodaju. Dla etogo dela ona xochet 1600 AZN. Pokupateli Arzu ochen dovolni I otzivayutsa o ney kak o dobroporadochnoy I chestnoy jenshine.
texts.en: Arzu is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Arzu started her business of selling women's clothes 13 years ago.  Arzu's husband is a craftsman and out of their combined income, they plan to build a house for their son.   At the present time, Arzu needs money in order to buy new things to sell.  For these purchases, she would like 1,600 AZN.  Arzu's customers are very satisfied and think of her as a scrupulous and honest woman.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for selling

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Abelinaa; lcontinua trabajando con la agricultura  y también tiene animales menores, como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, ovejas,  y tambien la socia continua con su tienda de abarrotes. a la socia le a ido muy bien y ahora desea poder implementar su tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual desea el credito y poder comprar arroz, azucar, fideos, leche entre otros.
texts.en: The member is Mrs. Abelina. She continues farming and also has small animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and sheep. She is also continuing with her general store. It has gone very well for her, and now she wants to be able to improve her general store. She wants the loan to be able to buy rice, sugar, pasta, and milk, among other items.

loans.use: to improve her general store

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Purificacion; continua trabajando con la agricultura  y también en artesanía la socia compra textiles y los lleva  a vender al poblado de Corao.  La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de textiles y artesanía asi mejorar economicamente, la socia compra lanas de alpaca entre otras y hace chompas tambiena mano; la socia sabe que el turismo se incrementara desde el mes de abril asi que desea estar preparada para cubrir la demanda.
texts.en: The member is Purificacion; she works in agriculture and also in handicrafts. The member buys textiles and takes them to the village of Corao to sell.  The member requests the loan to buy textiles and handicrafts to improve her financial situation. She buys alpaca wool, among others, and also makes sweaters by hand. She knows that tourism increases beginning in April, and she wants to be prepared to meet the demand.

loans.use: to buy textiles and wool to sell.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; continua trabajando en la agricultura y en comercio minorista, la socia vende verduras, con el apoyo de su hija; la socia tambien vende animales menores, y mayores. en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de pollos doble pechuga para incrementar sus ventas, a ella le suelen buscar las clientas para comprarle las gallinas doble pechugas.
texts.en: The member requesting the loan is called Ubaldina. She still works in agriculture and retail, selling vegetables with the help of her daughter. She also sells animals, both large and small. This time she would like to invest the loan in the purchase of double breasted chickens, in order to increase her sales. She often has customers coming to her to buy these chickens.

loans.use: purchase double breasted chickens.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

Evangeline operates a grocery stall, where she sells vegetables such as potatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a conducive business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables. 

Evangeline's dream and business goal is to be selling the vegetables in wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Garagoz

texts.ru: Garagoz zamujem, u nee troe detey. Ona rabotaet uchitelnicoy v mestnoy shkole i odnovremenno rabotaet kak chastniy repetitor detey. Muj Garagoz takje rabotaet uchitelem. Sfera biznesa yavlaetsa skotovodstvo kotorim ona nachala zanimatsa 6 let nazad. Ona prodayet molochnie produkti v sele gde ona jivet. Ey pomogaet ee semya v etom dele. Garagoz obratilas za dengami v summe 1500 AZN chtobi nachat delat remont doma I pereexat tuda jit.
texts.en: Garagoz is married and has three children.  She works as a teacher in the local school and as a private tutor.  Garagoz's husband is also a teacher.  Garagoz's business is cattle farming, which she took up 6 years ago.  She sells dairy products in the village where they live.  Her family helps her with the business.  Garagoz requested 1,500 AZN in order to begin repairs to their home and to move in to it.

loans.use: to begin home repairs

loans.name: Consolato

texts.en: Consolato is a married woman. She has a child who is 21 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a viable business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortages of charcoal for selling. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal. Consolato's dream and business goal is to be a charcoal supplier within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for selling

loans.name: Alhaji Mustapha

texts.en:
