He is requesting the loan to repair one of his trucks as it is damaged and this is one of the ways he works to support his family.

loans.use: to repair a truck.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is a fish monger at Mpohor, near Takoradi. She buys fresh fish and smokes it to sell. Matilda has been in this business for 5 years now. She is married to a driver and has 4 children. Matilda uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase large quantities of fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits, Matilda wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase large quantity of fresh fish to smoke to sell.

loans.name: Maalyir Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est la représentante du groupe MAALYIR. Elle est mariée et mère de  02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans  et le moins âgé a 16ans.01 va à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.

Mme prépare et vend  des ignames ; des beignets et des gâteaux  depuis 18ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à la cité AN 2  en ville. Ses clients sont  ses voisins du quartier.

 Mme veut  s’acheter  02 calebasses d’ignames et  01 sac d’haricot pour son commerce.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son commerce. Mme ambitionne  acheter du haricot pour stocker et revendre en période de soudure. Elle veut enlever dans son stock  pour préparer ses beignets.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata is the leader of the Maalyir group. She is a married mother of two children. The older child is 21 years old and the younger is 16. One of her children attends school. She has two people in her care.

Ms. Aminata has prepared and sold yams, fritters, and cakes for 18 years. She gets her supplies in the AN 2 area of the city. Her customers are her neighbours.

Ms. Aminata wants to buy two "calebasses" (containers made out of hollowed-out calabashes) of yams and one bag of beans for her business.

With her profits, she wants to strengthen her business. Ms. Aminata's ambition is to buy beans to stock and resell during lean times. She wants to draw from her stock to make fritters.

loans.use: To buy two "calebasses" (containers made out of hollowed-out calabashes) of yams and one bag of beans for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana plants, manure, urea, and fertilizers

loans.name: Ndonyi

texts.en:
Ndonyi is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She owns a retail shop, which has been running for the last one year. In this shop, she sells household products, foodstuff and cold drinks. She is also married and has two school going children.

Ndonyi has no other source of income and has a plan to improve her operations. Ndonyi is applying for a loan of 52,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional retail stock e.g. mineral water, drinks and food stuff. 

Ndonyi believes this loan will improve the living standards for her family and she aspires to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail stock e.g. mineral water, drinks and food stuff.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi fries plantain to sell. She serves it with bean stew. Esi has done this for 5 years now. She lives together with her husband and 4 children at Mpohor, near Takoradi. She uses her loan to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Esi will use her loan to purchase plantains and beans to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plantain and beans to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a fruit vender she sells orenges at Mpohor near Takoradi which she has done for 2 years. She is a single parent and has 1 child. As a single parent. She uses her income to feed and cloth her child. Esther will use her loan to purchase a variety of fruit to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and herbicides for weed control.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, organic compost, fertilizer and weed killer.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a married mother of four children who lives in Malindi, Kenya. She has been running a grocery stall for four years .She received the capital to start the business from her husband. 

Celestina was introduced to Milango by her friends. She looks forward to purchasing fruits and vegetables from the loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings. The business has provided a livelihood for her family and she looks forward to improve her operations, despite the challenges of high taxes and the high cost of transportation.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rods, drills, and welding materials

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in the Coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She has been operating a grocery stall for eight years. Martha harvested lime and oranges from her business and sold them to the neighboring customers to obtain the capital for the current business. She is a mother of six children.

Martha has been a member of Milango since late last year and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase carrots, tomatoes and onions. She aspires to continue with the business to be able to provide for her family.

The main challenges in the business are high taxation and seasonal weather, which has affected her farm output, and the high cost of purchased produce, a cost which she often passes onto the clients.

loans.use: to to purchase carrots, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He owns a chemist shop, which has been in operation for three years. The business has provided drugs to most residents of Malindi, a town with few hospitals and high population. He was previously employed in a health clinic and saved his monthly income, which he used to start the business. 

Philip was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy drugs for the chemist shop. He will save the additional income in the bank as he is planning to renovate the shop in the next seven months.

Philip's future ambition is to open a laboratory for testing, next to the chemist.

loans.use: to buy drugs for the chemist.

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of her group 'Jesus Esta Aqui' 1 & 2 (Jesus is here). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner, 3 children and 3 nephews. She says that her most difficult challenges are to raise her children and her nephews and to provides for their needs. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying eating and watching television.

Isabel is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for over 6, starting with her first loan with which she bought a stove and gas tank to fry food. She plans to use this loan to invest in her businesses to increase her inventory by purchasing goods like flour, meat, plantains, bags of used clothes, and others miscellaneous products like handbags and shoes. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to provide for her family, thus helping her partner. She wants to buy a home and have all her family together in a better house.

loans.use: To buy clothes, miscellaneous products, and goods for fried food and breakfast

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit «Furahini », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 7 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuses des articles divers. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle  a été mariée. Son mari est un pasteur évangéliste dans une communauté ecclésiastique protestante. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  7eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  huile, sucres, Fanta, savons, sels, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir, ouvrir une boutique et acheter une parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: The client, a member of the "Furahini" loan group, is a 37-year-old married entrepreneur with seven young children, all of whom are in school. She sells various goods. She began her business after she got married. Her husband is an evangelical pastor in an ecclesiastic Protestant community. Meanwhile, she has just obtained her seventh loan from Hekima. This new loan should serve to supply her with oil, sugar, Fanta, soap, salt, etc. In addition, she hopes to watch her children grow, to open a store, and to buy a plot of land. This client is grateful to Hekima for its actions helping poor women who have been excluded from the classical banking system achieve autonomy. It should be noted that certain clients in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, Fanta, soap, flour, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Amparo

texts.es:
Zoila Amparo tiene 22 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en San Miguel de Bolívar provincia de Bolívar.

Zoila es ayudante de ventas de licores.  Solicita el crédito para comprar muebles una lavadora y un microondas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá acondicionar la vivienda.  Las compras las va ha realizar en San Miguel. 

El sueño es poder mejorar la calidad de vida, establecer un negocio con toda la familia.

El desafío que enfrenta es poder estudiar. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, camuinar con los amigos.
texts.en:
Zoila Amparo is 22 years old, single and does not have children. She lives with her parents in San Miguel de Bolivar Canton in Bolivar Province.

Zoila is a liquor sales assistant. She is applying for a loan to purchase furniture, a washing machine and a microwave oven.

With the help of a loan she will be able to upgrade her house. She will make her purchases in San Miguel.

Her dream is to be able to improve the quality of life of and establish a business with the whole family. The challenge she confronts is being able to study.

In her spare time she enjoys playing sports and walking with friends.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, a washing machine and a microwave.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married and has 2 children. Editha is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Editha is a farmer and grows assorted crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase fertilizers for her agriculture activities. 

Editha has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her cropping activities.

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of his group, Jesus está Aquí (Jesus is Here) group 2 & 4. This group is compounded by Dominican and Haitian borrowers, and their are located in the slums area in the north of Santo Domingo, the capital city. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Margarita is excited to be taking her 6th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her businesses selling tennis and casual shoes and a comedor, a small restaurant where she sells meal for lunch. She will purchase pairs of shoes as well as rice, beans, cooking oil, meat, and other goods to prepare the meals. She will use the profits to finish building her home. She started with some of her savings and now she is planning to dedicate her benefits to the house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes and goods for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 52 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with 5 children. 
Fely has a mini grocery business and earns approximately PHP 6,200 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 50,000 to purchase more stock for her grocery store. Fely has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with 3 children. Juliet is 53 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga.
Juliet sells used clothing to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 to purchase 10 bundles of used clothing to sell.
Juliet has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Wendmalgkondo Group

texts.fr:
Mme JOSEPHINE  est la représentante du groupe WENDMALGKONDO. Elle est mariée  et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 19ans. 04  vont à l’école. Elle a 08 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du jus depuis  05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes provinces du BURKINA .Ses clients sont  les élèves ; amis ; voisins et les citadins.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac de sucre, 01 gros paquet de sachets pour le conditionnement, 05 kg de lait et 10 assiettées de mil pour la fabrication du jus.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut subvenir aux besoins familials et contribuer à la scolarité des enfants.  Elle ambitionne  agrandir son activité ; ouvrir une alimentation de vente de jus et de dèguè.
texts.en:
Ms. Josephine is the leader of the Wendmalgkondo group. She is a married mother of seven. Her eldest child is 35 years old and her youngest is 19. Four of them attend school. She has eight people in her care.

She has sold juice for five years. She gets her supplies in various provinces of Burkina Faso. Her customers are students, friends, neighbours, and city-dwellers.

She wants to buy one bag of sugar, one large box of bags for packaging, 5 kg of milk, and ten platefuls of millet to prepare juice.

With her profits, she wants to provide for her family and contribute to her children's education. Her ambition is to expand her business and open a food store selling juice and "degue" (a type of porridge).

loans.use: To buy one bag of sugar, one large box of bags for packaging, 5 kg of milk, and ten platefuls of millet to prepare juice.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. Gladys owns a retail shop which she has been running for three years. In this shop, Gladys sells rice, detergents, drinking water, cooking fat etc.
Gladys is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock e.g. cooking fat, paraffin, beans, rice etc. She is also employed elsewhere.
The challenge facing the business is the low season which starts with the rainy season. During this time, there are few tourists and Malindi heavily depends on tourism.
The income from this loan will help her pay for her children’s school fees. She believes the business will grow to a large grocery stall in the future.

loans.use: To to purchase retail stock e.g. cooking fat, paraffin, beans, rice etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a mother of two young children, none of whom have begun schooling. She lives in Malindi, Kenya and has been running a food stall for three years. In this business, Fatuma sells cooked food to the residents of the town.

She looks forward to improve the operations of her business and is asking for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, rice, etc. The challenge she needs to overcome is the effects of low season. This comes when most tourists return to their home countries; Malindi heavily depends on tourism. She therefore plans to make enough sales at the moment.

Fatuma’s ambition is to open other branches within the town in future. She believes the investment will help educate the children once they begin schooling.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, rice, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya and runs a charcoal business. The business has been in operation for fifteen years. He is a married father of two children. He started the business from the loans he received from a micro finance. He has since paid off the loans.

Despite the challenge of high cost of fuel, David aspires to own a larger shelter from where he can sell the charcoal. David learned of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya and owns a barber shop. He has operated the business for one year. He is single and also runs a ration store. The retail store has been in operation for four years.

Antony was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to purchase shaving machines and also to add stock of food stuff to his ration store.

Antony's ambition is to own a restaurant and Antony believes the above ventures will help him be self-reliant. His other interests are to sell music compact discs.

loans.use: to purchase shaving machines and add stock of food stuff to his ration store.

loans.name: Norma Group

texts.en:
Norma is married with 3 children. She is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Norma is a farmer and grows assorted vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable plants. Norma has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. She is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable plants

loans.name: Lluva Group

texts.en:
Lluva is 52 years old and lives in Calilic, Sibutad. She is married with 3 children. 
Lluva has a mini grocery business and earns approximately PHP 3,200 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase more stock of grocery items such as 2 boxes of carbonated beverages and milk. 
Lluva has been a member of PMPC for a year. She is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items such as 2 boxes of carbonated beverages and milk

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie is a married woman having 3 children. Genevie is 33 years old and resides at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Genevie operates a family member's business venture, she sells fish while her husband harvests fish-caught for their living. She's been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000.00 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 10,000.00 PHP to repair their fishing boat. 

Recently, Genevie has become a member of GDMPC. In the future, Genevie wants to build a house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia is separated and has two children. She is 37 years old and lives in the village of San Pedro in Pagadian City, Philippines. Cornelia used her last loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Her business has grown up and become successful. At this time, she's taking a new loan for her fishing business to repair her fishing boat. Positively, she hopes to be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is married and has 4 children. She is 37 years old, residing at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Emma is operating a gardening business venture and been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000.00 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 29,000.00 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 69 years old. Peregrina is widowed and has 4 children. To make a living, Peregrina owns and operates a tailoring business, tailoring and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Peregrina has been in her business for 27 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2008, Peregrina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Peregrina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married and has 2 children. She is 34 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Sibutad.

Jennifer sells cosmetic items to earn a living and has had this business for almost 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3600 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase skin care products.

Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase skin care products.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married and has 2 children. She is 43 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Sibutad ZDN.

Myrna has a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for a year. Each month, she earns PHP 3800 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase frozen dinners for her grocery business.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase frozen dinners for her grocery business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is married and has 5 children. She is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lanie is a farmer and grows assorted vegetables to earn her living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for her crop of vegetables production. 

Lanie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her crop of vegetables production.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly, 62, is widowed and resides with a daughter in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a commune counselor for over three years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Somaly is requesting for a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a generator to run a business of charging batteries. This loan will enable her to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase a generator to run a business of charging batteries.

loans.name: Giovanny Del Carmen

texts.es: Giovanny Del Carmen tiene 29 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio sus clientes la visitan por la calidad de producto que les ofrece y el servicio. Giovanny tiene dos hijos que están todavía está en su cargo y están estudiando su mayor sueño de la emprendedora es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean personas de bien. La emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar calzado, ropa, sandalias, variedad de cosméticos entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Giovanny Del Carmen is 29 years old. She sells general merchandise and already has years of experience in the business. Her customers visit her for the quality of her products and the service. Giovanny has two children who are still dependent on her and are in school. This entrepreneur's greatest dream is for her children to finish their studies and become good people. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes, clothing, sandals, a variety of cosmetics, and other requested products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, sandals, a variety of cosmetics, and other products

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 45 years old and lives in Panduman, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is widowed and has 4 children. Cecilia used her last loan to purchase additional stocks of salted and dried fish to sell. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase more salted and dried fish to sell. Positively, she hopes to be able to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase salted and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 28 years old and lives in Locus, Sapang Dalaga. She is married and has 2 children. 

Rosalie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase motor spare parts needed to transport the fish to other community. 

Rosalie has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase motor spare parts needed to transport fish to other communities.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and has 1 child. She is 50 years old and lives in Silongon,Tudela.

Evangeline is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this type of business for 5 years.

Evangeline has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inorganic fertilizers. She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional inorganic fertilizers.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 61 years old and is married. She has 6 children. She is living in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. 

Marcelina is a charcoal seller and has proved her business ability for 30 years. Every month, she earns PHP 4,200. Marcelina was an official GDMPC member in 2007. With this 5th loan, worth PHP 10,000, she plans to purchase coconut shells for making charcoal. She is hoping to make more income from the additional investment.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran. She is married and has four children. 

Emma has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 600 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business. 

Emma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Emma hopes to have a food stall in the market because they want  their children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Doljmaa

texts.en: Doljmaa is 58 years old and lives with her two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her elder son is employed and the younger one is a college student. She was a nanny before she retired and started her sewing business in 2009. Her sewing skill is excellent and she is well known in her neighborhood. Therefore, she has many regular customers. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My business is finally picking up and I don't want to lose this opportunity ". She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Clarecil

texts.en:
Clarecil is from Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old. Clarecil is married and has three children. Clarecil owns and operates a farm. The farm's main source of income comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell, like "eggplant and squash". Clarecil has been in her business for 7 years and earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business. 

In 2009, Clarecil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business. Clarecil is now requesting from GDMPC, a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn, 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns approximately USD 2 per day. Two her children are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a construction worker. They earn approximately USD 7 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Savoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase cattle to use in her farming work. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house. She would like to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family and to help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use in her farming work.

loans.name: Saica

texts.en:
Saica is a married woman, having 2 children. Saica is 32 years old and resides at St. Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Saica is operating a fishing business venture, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She's been 7 years in this business. Each month, she earns 10,000.00 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 50,000.00 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2008, Saica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Saica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Venus Group

texts.en:
Venus is single. She is 50 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Venus sells rice palay to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP3,000.00 to purchase more sacks of rice for her retail business.

Venus has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Venus hopes to expand her rice retail business. Venus is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for her retail business.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en: Naranchimeg is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband works in a construction site. Her elder two children are school students and the younger one is also a school student. She started her garment retailing business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. She sells children's garment and boots. Her products are elegant and low priced. She goes to China by herself to get the supplies. However, it is very expensive to go to China. Therefore, she needs to buy more products in order to save some money. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: to buy more garments.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 29 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has 2 children. 

Dickson has a fish selling business and earns approximately PHP 6,000.00 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. 

Dickson has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Dickson hopes to expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 59, began Prestigious Cleaning Service in San Antonio, Texas after looking for an alternate type of business to work in while she juggles a full-time job. She decided to get into the janitorial industry because “it seemed like a good thing to do,” she said. “So far so good.”

Prestigious Cleaning Service began in July 2011 when Elizabeth realized every business needs their office cleaned but not everybody wants or can afford to do it.

Currently, she employs two people besides herself and works only in commercial buildings. Elizabeth plans to hire more workers as her business grows. 

Elizabeth plans to use her ACCION Texas Inc. loan to pay for salaries, and to pay Jan-Pro Cleaning Systems, which markets and secures her business while she continues to work full time. 

“The ACCION loan will give me an opportunity to hire staff to clean businesses. I really appreciate this opportunity,” she said adding that the loan will also help hire more people for additional evening work.

loans.use: To pay the salaries of her employees.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is married and has 4 children. She is 48 years old and lives in Silongon,Tudela.

Beverly is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Beverly has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional fertlizers. 

Beverly has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Beverly hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertlizers.

loans.name: 16 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “16 DE ABRIL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de de Villa Adela.  Está compuesta por siete integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Constancia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, elaboración de macramé, venta de comida, venta de lana, tienda.

La señora Constancia, indica que es la primera ves que conforma una asociación y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de artesanías que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su cuñado. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de lana) que adquiere de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene siete hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The lending club "April 16th" will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center of Villa Adela. The group is made up of 7 members and they have a board of directors led by Constancia. The members have various businesses including embroidering tablecloths, making macrame, selling food, selling wool, and a store. 

Constancia says that this is her first time being part of an association. For some years now she has had a business selling crafts, a trade that she learned from her brother-in-law. The loan this cycle is to increase her merchandise by purchasing wool in the city of El Alto and later selling it in her stall. This form of work allows her to support her family - she is single and has 7 children.

She asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the meetings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 37 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Liza is married with three children. 

Liza has a general store where she sells a variety of products. Liza has had this business for 10 years. Liza requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Liza has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Liza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 65 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. She is married with five children. 

To earn a living, Elena has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She earns about PHP 6,500 each month doing this type of work. Elena has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Elena has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luna

texts.en:
Maria Luna is 41 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Maria Luna is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Maria Luna has a business selling banana cue in the local community. Maria Luna earns about PHP 1,300 each month doing this type of work.

Maria Luna has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional bananas to make and sell her banana cue.

Maria Luna has been a member of PMPC for five months.  In the future, Maria Luna would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix Adolfo es un emprendedor que ha creado su propio herramienta de trabajo para sacar a su familia adelante y brindarle a sus hijos lo mejor. Este emprendedor ya  ha trabajado con Fundación León 2000, lo cual durante el crédito ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseo de superación en lo personal y en su negocio, el crédito anterior lo invirtió en el negocio aumentando su producto y sus clientes ya que le ofrece variedad de productos. Actualmente el emprendedor  está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pasta de dientes huevos, pan, cuajada, entre otros productos para la pulpería.
texts.en: Félix Adolfo is an entrepreneur that has created his own work to help his family progress and give his children the best. This businessman has worked with the Fundacion Leon 2000 before. With his last loan he proved himself to be to be responsible and wanting to better himself both on a personal and professional level. He invested his last loan in increasing his products and his clientele, and now he offers a variety of goods. Currently he is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, rice, oil, sugar, toothpaste, bread, cheese and other products for his small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, beans, oil, sugar, toothpaste, eggs, bread, cheese, and other products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is married with no children. Carmencita is 54 years old and lives in Pta. Sulong, Baliangao.

Carmencita sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase five cases of soft drinks and assorted groceries.

Carmencita has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and assorted groceries

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang is from the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She was born and grew up there. She was married in her 20s and now she is 55 years old and a mother of five children.  Presently, two of her children have already started their own families. Eang earns a living by operating a pig raising business and her husband cultivates rice and vegetables.

To sustain her business, Eang would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase four piglets to place and fatten in her wooden pigpen. This is Eang's first loan with our firm. She said that it will improve her living.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets

loans.name: Sergia Group

texts.en:
Sergia is married with nine children. Sergia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Sergia is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers.
 
Sergia has been a member of PMPC for a year. Sergia is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of ferilizers

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with four children. Regina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Regina is a farmer and grows assorted crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 22 years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for her cropping activity.
 
Regina has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Elma Group

texts.en:
Elma is 50 years old and lives in Casul, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with four children.
 
Elma works in the fish industry and catches/sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials such as fish nets, hooks, and Fish-skull sculpin helmets.
 
Elma has been a member of PMPC for four years. Elma is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials such as fish nets, hooks, and Fish-skull sculpin helmets

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is married with six children. Liza is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. Liza provides transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for two years and every month she earns 2,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2011, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Liza hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José es originario de Estelí con 30 años de edad, tiene a su cargo a un hijo, vive con su compañera de vida,  el es comerciante desde hace 20 años se dedica a la tapicería, sus estudios los realizo hasta el bachillerato. Sus actividades las inicio con un préstamo que realizo a la edad de 20 años  cuando decidió independizarse con el negocio de tapicería y este ha sido desde entonces su primer negocio ya que la ha generado ganancias, no cuenta ningún otro ingreso.  Hoy en día decide realizar el  préstamo para la compra de pega, esponjas y accesorios que son necesarios para forrar muebles.
 El estima que este préstamo lo ayudara ya que podrá ir a Managua a comprar los materiales donde los podrá adquirir más baratos y rentables pensando como planes futuros llegar a surtir mas el negocio con la compra de mas materiales y lograr construir su casa para tener un local propio donde pueda trabajar sin necesidad de andar alquilando.
texts.en:
José is originally from Estelí and is 30 years old. He has one son and lives with his common-law wife. He has been in the upholstery business since he was 20 years old. He finished his high school degree. He began with a loan that he received at the age of 20, when he decided to become independent by starting an upholstery business. Since then, this has been his main business and it is profitable. He does not have any other source of income.

Today, he has decided to take out a loan to buy glue, sponges, and necessary accessories for covering furniture. He reckons that this loan will help because it will enable him to go to Managua, where he can buy materials at a lower and more profitable price.

José's future plans are to better-stock his business by buying more materials and to build a house where he can work without having to rent a separate space.

loans.use: to buy glue, sponges, and accessories for upholstering furniture

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 27 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is married with one infant child.

Ginalyn has a grocery store. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase carbonated beverages.

Ginalyn is a new member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated beverages

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio es un joven de 25 años de edad, originario de Estelí, soltero se dedica desde hace 1 año a ser barbero actualmente está estudiando la universidad. Su negocio lo empezó con dinero que obtuvo trabajando a medias en una barbería después de un año de trabajar ahí decidió poner su propio negocio de barbería para obtener mayores ganancias, el solo saca su negocio adelante en el local que alquila  asumiendo que es un negocio muy bueno y rentable debido a que tiene buena clientela. Julio solicita el préstamo para la compra de cerámica para remodelar el piso de su barbería para darle una mejor apariencia a su negocio ya que esto le dará una mejor visión que le hará tener más clientela y  teniendo a planes futuros ampliar el negocio para poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Julio is a 25 year old young man, originally from Estelí. He is single and has worked as a barber for a year and is attending university. He started his business with money he earned from working in a barbershop for a year and decided to have his own shop to have more earnings. He works alone in his business; his shop is rented and has a very good business that is profitable since he has good customers. Julio needs the loan to buy tiles to remodel the floor of his barbershop to give it a better appearance since this will give his business a better look that will help him acquire more customers. Julio plans to expand his business to continue to get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy tiles to remodel the floor of his barbershop.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 56 years old and lives in the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is widowed with five children. Juanita used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. Now she's taking a new loan to purchase new food items to expand her product offering. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase new food items to expand her product offering

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fabriana

texts.en: Fabriana is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 69 years old. Fabriana is widowed and has five children. To make a living, Fabriana buys and sells dried fish in the local community. Fabriana has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it. In 2009, Fabriana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fabriana is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more dried fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosas Lindas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS LINDAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Maribel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de dulces y juguetes, venta de muebles, venta de zapatos, venta de comida, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de celulares MP3 MP4, venta de tenis.

La señora Maribel, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace siete años y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de dulces, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de una amiga. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de dulces) estos productos los adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es divorciada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Beautiful Roses” will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal of Juan Pablo. The communal bank is made up of eight members, they have a managing board and the head is Mrs. Maribel. The businesses that the members have are all different and include the sales of: candy and toys, furniture, shoes, food, sport attire, cell phones, MP3s and MP4s, and tennis shoes.

Mrs. Maribel has been a part of the communal bank for some seven years and at present has a business selling candy. She has worked on her business for several years and learned her trade from a friend. The loan will be used to increase her merchandize (buy candy) the products will be bought at city markets of El Alto and will be later sold in her stall. This works allows Mrs. Maribel to support her family since she is divorced and has two children.

When asked what likes most of Pro Mujer, Mrs. Maribel says she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: buy candy.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married with three children. He is 40 years old and resides at Tinotongan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.

Joel is operating a gardening business venture for a living and his been in this business for nine years. Each month, he earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Joel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Joel wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase additional farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Yoel Henry

texts.es:
Yoel, tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, por su agricultura y por la generosidad que demuestran sus pobladores: Yoel es un joven muy trabajador anteriormente trabaja como albañil en obras de construcción , pero tuvo varios accidentes y que gracias a Dios nunca paso a mayores, por ello el decidió trabajar en otro rubro y gracias a su esfuerzo y a su lucha constante, el ahorro dinero y pudo comprar dos mototaxis; él trabajaba en una y la otra la alquila y con ello tiene un poco mas de ingresos, desde hace dos años el viene esforzándose mucho, el cree que gracias a ese esfuerzo y sobre todo la ayuda de Dios y el apoyo incondicional de su esposa es que le va bien en su negocio.

Yoel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar el mantenimiento a sus mototaxis, así como también cambiarles los asiento, así el podrá mejorar su vehículo y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando día a día para cumplir su gran sueño:”Darle una profesión a su hijo e iniciar un negocio en su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Yoel is 23 years old and lives with his wife and young son in the city of Imperial, a city that is characterized by its warm climate, agriculture and the generosity of its inhabitants. Yoel is a young very hard worker that used to work as a mason in construction sites but had many accidents and thankfully it was never serious and decided to work in another field. Thanks to Yoel’s hard work and constant struggle he saved enough money and was able to buy two motorcycle taxis. He works with one motorcycle taxi and the other he rents and is able to have a bit more income. Yoel has worked hard for about two years and believes that his efforts but above all God’s help and the unconditional support of his wife have helped his business do well.

Yoel is very grateful to the Kiva loaners since thanks to their help he will be able to make some maintenance repairs on his motorcycle taxis as well as change the seats to improve the vehicles and provide better service to his customers. This will allow him to have better income and give his family a better quality of life as well as to continue working each day to see his greatest dream come true, “see his son become a professional and to start a business in his home.”

loans.use: make maintenance repairs and change the seats.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mon, 63, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over three years, earning approximately USD 20 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who approximately earns USD 10 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Mon is requesting for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase rice to resell to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Sony

texts.en: Sony, 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over five years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband is involved in breeding pigs to sell. He earns approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sony is requesting for a loan of USD 800 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business renting music equipment and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Zavhan province in Western Mongolia. Her husband  is an entrepreneur who runs the taxi service. Her two children study in college and high school. She has been running a meat retailing business since 2000. The business has been stable and successful in these years as there are many regular suppliers and customers in the town. Dolgorsuren is a good- natured and intelligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the supplies, some sheep so that I could trade them in wholesale and raise the income". The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase the sheep and to buy spare parts for her husband's car.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and to buy spare part for the car

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam, 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over 20 years and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening cattle. She earns approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns about USD 4 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn approximately USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Nam is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to use to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Luciben

texts.en:
This is Luciben, 29, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Evelyn, his business partner. Luciben, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luciben operates a rolling store. His rolling store is basically a small house wares store, where he sells retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers or basins to the local neighborhood. He drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Luciben hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Shelan

texts.en:
Shelan is a 23-year-old young Iraqi wife. She has been using her sewing skills for the past three years, seeking opportunities to contribute to her family's financial needs.

In the past Shelan has successfully received and repaid a loan to Relief International Microfinance Iraq. With the loan, she was able to buy an old, but good, sewing machine with a table and chair. 

Now Shelan is taking a loan for $1800 USD to improve her work area and to be able to buy more fabric and raw materials for her business. 

Because Shelan is under 30, she qualifies for a 'youth loan.'

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work area and be able to buy more fabric and raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Subihiya

texts.en:
Subihiya is a 50-year-old mother of six from northern Israel. She has run a book and gift shop for several years and now is diversifying her store to strengthen its sales capability. While books are still a popular item, Subihiya has seen a drop in sales and profit and has decided to begin including additional items in her store. There is a degree of seasonality to her merchandise and after careful consideration of what customers need and want from the store, she is expanding. Her first addition is to include sportswear, gifts and school items.


Subihiya needed this loan to expand and diversify her merchandise to purchase sports shoes, toys, clothing and perfumes.

In the future Subihiya wants to continue to stabilize her sales and add school uniforms and supplies. She is proud of her accomplishments but knows if she wants her business to remain profitable, she must adapt.

loans.use: To expand and diversify her merchandise to purchase sports shoes, toys, clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está divorciado,  vive con su papa actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y mano de obra para asistir la siembra de café. el cuenta con una plantación de ya en producción por lo cual necesita asistirla pues esta cosecha pasado dio un buen rendimiento y necesita fortalecerse para la próxima cosecha. El tiene pensado con esta asistencia darle el máximo de mejoras para obtener de él un buen rendimiento en producción el próximo año y generar mayores ganancias a esta cosecha pasada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Víctor Manuel is 50, divorced and lives with his father.  With this loan he plans to buy inputs to improve his coffee crop, such as fertilizer, and to pay for laborers to tend the coffee trees.  He has a plantation which is nearing harvest time.  His last harvest was very good and needs to assure success in the next crop.  With this assistance he hopes to maximize production next near and generate higher profits.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has no banking credit history, but FUDECOSUR has offered good terms and very low interest rates.

loans.use: to tend his coffee plantation

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos que son su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de alimento y vitaminas de buena calidad y adecuados, además de tener cerdos de razas de buen desarrollo y con carne de buena calidad. Al poder comprar todos los materiales a utilizar espera tener una producción con un buen desarrollo y posteriormente un ingreso adecuado para así darle el sustento a su familia y pagar lo que le corresponde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rodolfo is 35, single, and lives with his parents and siblings.  With this credit he plans to buy animal feed and good quality vitamins to raise well-developed pigs to produce high quality pork.  By buying these items he hopes to increase production, resulting in enough income to support his family. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken out prior loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him good terms and very low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 20 años  vive( guasmo Guayaquil) – el escogió este trabajo porque sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo que es la pesca de cangrejos. El trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas y esfuezo. En el futuro el desea engrandar su negocio teniendo mas salidas para pescar. Con el préstamo comprara (redes para la pesca etc).
texts.en: Julio is 20 and lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil, Ecuador.  He chose the same line of work of his parents: crab fishing.  He works hard every day and hopes to grow his business by increasing his fishing capacity.  With this loan, he will buy fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Mayra Mirella

texts.es: Mayra de 29 años vive( duran ecuador). Ella empeso vendiendo de apoco ropa. Luego fue progresando. También es profesora particular le enseña a  los niños de su barrio. Trabaja todos los días sola con esfuerzo. A futuro ella desea ampliar su local de ropa. Con el préstamo comprara ( libros y ropa para mejorar sus ingresos etc).
texts.en: Mayra is 29 and lives in Duran, Ecuador.  She has recently begun to sell clothing, which so far has been going well.  She also works as a private teacher for children in her neighborhood.  She works hard every day and in the future would like to grow her clothing sales.  With this loan, she will buy books and clothing items, in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy school books and clothing

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio Tiene 26 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

José es maestro da clases en una escuela de la ciudad. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un computador.
 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá contar con una computadora para poder realizar los planes didácticos, realizar las pruebas de los alumnos y le servirá para poder realizar otros trabajos. 

La compra lo realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño  es ser un profesional y utilizar de la mejor manera la tecnología para lo posterior pensar en un negocio.

Los desaf{ios a los que se enfrenta son la falta de dinero cuando más se necesita. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear e irse de vacaciones y trabajar en el campo.
texts.en: José Antonio is 26, single, with no children.  He lives with his parents in Chimbo, Bolívar province, Ecuador.  José is a teacher in a local school  He seeks this credit in order to buy a computer.  With this credit, he plans to use the computer to complete his lesson plans and student tests, as well as many other tasks.  He plans to purchase the computer in the city of Guaranda.  His dream is to work as a professional and make best use of technology to eventually open a business.  He faces the challenge of not having enough capital when he needs it.  In his free time he enjoys taking trips and working in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Alba Rebeca

texts.es:
Alba Rebeca tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 15 años de edad en Chimbo Provincia de bolívar.

Alba se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar abonos, urea, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, fungicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá estar tranquilo porque va ha tener dinero para trabajar en los cultivos.

El sueño es poder tener terrenos propios para aumentar el ingreso para la familia.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los animales.
texts.en: Alba Rebeca is 49, married, has one child and lives with her husband and 15-year old son in Chimbo, Bolívar province, Ecuador.  Alba is a corn farmer.  She seeks this credit in order to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, fungicides.  This loan will give her peace of mind and resources to tend her crops.  She dreams of working her own land to increase her family's income.  Her main challenge is competition.  In her free time she enjoys caring for animals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, fungicides.
